intro: Dentaria enneaphyllos f. alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaved toothwort, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate arrangement of leaves, which gives it its specific epithet "alternifolia." The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices, where it can access the necessary nutrients and moisture. Its flowering stems bear small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
